history.content:
Its typical to not hear back at all. However generally from my experience most companies try to get back to you within 2-3 weeks. 

Additionally as a rule of thumb: if you don't have a referral to get you into a company, you should expect no response or a generic rejection (this doesn't always happen for everybody, but this is usually what happens).

As per the thing someone was saying before about not getting in without referrals—that's completely false, I've gotten almost all my interviews from just applying online without a referral, even at FAANG. Don't lose hope, apply as broadly as you can, look for opportunities that are posted recently, and keep trying!! You got this!!

Its typical to not hear back at all.

Additionally as a rule of thumb: if you don't have a referral to get you into a company, you should expect no response or a generic rejection (this doesn't always happen for everybody, but this is usually what happens).

children.subject: Consider applying through Linkedin and this website https://github.com/Pitt-CSC/Summer2021-Internships. I'm a transfer and manage to get a lot of phone interviews (15 phones including FAANG out of 90 applications) through these channels only, and I only have cs 61a on my transcript. It takes me from 3 weeks to 3 months to hear back from them. I didn't receive any phone interviews through handshake but ymmv.

history.content:
Hi friends I am a sophomore and am looking for possible internships for the coming summer. I am not exactly sure how the process works, and I heard handshake is a good place to start, so I just applied for a couple of them (around 7) at the beginning of November. I haven't heard back from any of them, though.

I am totally ready to be rejected by all of them since I am pretty inexperienced and my resume is no way from being outstanding. I just wonder how long should I wait before moving on.

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Approximately how long does it take to hear back from applications for internships?
